value:
Father... Mother... My dream is to
bring forth a world where all can
live happily. But am I being naive?

From the moment I clasped Hector's
hand, I could feel his strength, his
confidence. He's brimming with both.

Father once told me that overwork is
a road leading to nothing. When it
gets tough, he said, you need rest.

Sometimes studying history feels
meaningless... Rulers clash, but it
all ends with their people suffering.

There are others here my age or
even younger. Yet they are strong
enough to be called Heroes...

I am Eliwood of Pherae. I have been
told much of your stout heart by
$Nf.

I will do Pherae proud—for myself,
my parents, and for the people!

I must gather myself. I cannot
protect anyone if I don't.

We may have defeated the foe
in front of us, but that does not
mean we can rest easy.
I thank you.

I am Eliwood, son of the marquess
of Pherae. I would be honored if
you accepted me into your circle.

The nations of Lycia have banded
together to protect ourselves from
threats from the outside and within.$k$pOur parents have sworn that all in the
alliance fight as one, no matter who
is attacked—or by whom.$k$pWhile our parents were swearing that
oath, we children were assembled in
another chamber...$k$pIt was then that Hector called on us
to swear an oath of our own, as he
sliced his palm with his knife.$k$pClasping cut palms is a famous
custom of warriors—an oath of
friendship sealed by lifeblood.$k$pMy hand was the only one that
met his.$k$pOur friendship began with that vow.
When one is in danger, the other will
risk everything to save him...$k$pThat is the promise I made to Hector
that day. I will draw from his strength
as I take stewardship of Pherae.
I must not lose!
I will match my father!
I'll get stronger!
My blade strikes true!
Must...train more...
I am Eliwood, son of Marquess Elbert of Pherae.
*gasp* You startled me! How may I help you?
My parents are so happy when they're together.
Can you help me find my friend? His name is Hector.
To follow in my father's footsteps and protect Pherae… That is my dream.
Mother, Father... I hope you're thinking about me.
I want to learn as much as I can while I'm here. Consider me at your disposal.
I understand.
What next?
Leave this to me.
